theoryText: Based on Brook's introduction in Episode 338, fans theorized that Brook might be connected to Laboon, the whale the Straw Hats met at Reverse Mountain. Brook mentions he was part of a pirate crew that died, and Laboon was waiting for a pirate crew that never returned from the Grand Line. Many fans speculated these could be the same crew - the Rumbar Pirates.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Brook mentions being part of a pirate crew that was destroyed
Laboon was waiting for pirates who never returned
Timeline matches with Laboon's wait of over 50 years
Brook's age and the timeframe of his death align with Laboon's story

theoryTitle: The Yomi Yomi no Mi's True Power
theoryText: When Episode 338 revealed Brook's Yomi Yomi no Mi ability, fans theorized that the Devil Fruit must have additional powers beyond simple resurrection. Since Brook had already used the resurrection ability, fans speculated the fruit would grant soul-based abilities that Brook hadn't discovered yet, potentially allowing him to interact with souls or use his own soul in combat.
author: One Piece Theory Community
evidence: The fruit is called 'Revive-Revive' but resurrection can only happen once
Most Paramecia fruits have multiple applications
Brook's soul survived separation from his body for a year
The fruit 'strengthens the soul' according to Brook's explanation
counterEvidence: No evidence of additional abilities shown in Episode 338

theoryText: After Episode 338 revealed that Brook's shadow was stolen, preventing him from going into sunlight, fans immediately began theorizing about who could have this power. Many speculated it would be a Warlord of the Sea or a powerful Devil Fruit user who could manipulate shadows. Some correctly guessed it would be Gecko Moria using a shadow-based Devil Fruit.
author: One Piece Speculation Community
evidence: The power to steal shadows suggests a Devil Fruit ability
Operating in the lawless Florian Triangle suggests a powerful pirate
The scale of Thriller Bark suggests a major antagonist
Warlord-level threat would fit the arc's position in the story
